uk.ac.open.kmi.iserve.sal.manager

Interface ServiceManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    iServeComponent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServiceManagerIndexRdf, ServiceManagerSparql

    public interface ServiceManager
extends iServeComponent
    Interface that defines the operations a Service Manager should offer If other implementations backed by different types of storage systems are needed we should update this.
    Author:
    Carlos Pedrinaci (KMi - The Open University), Luca Panziera (KMi - The Open University)

        shutdown

    • Method Detail

      • addService

        URI addService(uk.ac.open.kmi.msm4j.Service service)
               throws ServiceException
        Creates a Service Description in the system. Only needs to be fed with an MSM Service description. After successfully adding a service, implementations of this method should raise a ServiceCreatedEvent
        Parameters:
        service - the input service description in terms of MSM
        Returns:
        the URI this service description was saved to
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • addRelatedDocumentToService

        boolean addRelatedDocumentToService(URI serviceUri,
                                  URI relatedDocument)
                                    throws SalException
        Relates a given document to a service. The relationship is just a generic one.
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the service URI
        relatedDocument - the related document URI
        Returns:
        True if successful or False otherwise
        Throws:
        SalException

      • getService

        uk.ac.open.kmi.msm4j.Service getService(URI serviceUri)
                                        throws ServiceException
        Obtains the service description of the service identified by the URI
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the URI of the service to obtain
        Returns:
        the service description if it exists or null otherwise
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • getServices

        Set<uk.ac.open.kmi.msm4j.Service> getServices(Set<URI> serviceUris)
                                              throws ServiceException
        Obtains the service descriptions for all the services identified by the URI Set
        Parameters:
        serviceUris - the URIs of the service to obtain
        Returns:
        the list of all services that could be obtained. If none could be obtained the list will be empty.
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • listServices

        Set<URI> listServices()
        Obtains a list of service URIs with all the services known to the system
        Returns:
        list of URIs with all the services in the registry

      • listOperations

        Set<URI> listOperations(URI serviceUri)
        Obtains the list of operation URIs for a given Operation
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the service URI
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs with the operations provided by the service. If there are no operations, the Set should be empty NOT null.

      • listInputs

        Set<URI> listInputs(URI operationUri)
        Obtains the list of input URIs for a given Operation
        Parameters:
        operationUri - the operation URI
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs with the inputs of the operation. If no input is necessary the Set should be empty NOT null.

      • listTypedInputs

        com.google.common.collect.Multimap<URI,URI> listTypedInputs(URI operationUri)
        Given an operation, this method obtains the list of input URIs mapped to their annotated types (i.e., modelReferences). Note that the same input may have several annotations indicating the type.
        Parameters:
        operationUri - the URI for which we want to obtain the inputs and their annotated types
        Returns:
        a Multimap with the inputs and their corresponding types.

      • listOutputs

        Set<URI> listOutputs(URI operationUri)
        Obtains the list of output URIs for a given Operation
        Parameters:
        operationUri - the operation URI
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs with the outputs of the operation. If no output is provided the Set should be empty NOT null.

      • listTypedOutputs

        com.google.common.collect.Multimap<URI,URI> listTypedOutputs(URI operationUri)
        Given an operation, this method obtains the list of output URIs mapped to their annotated types (i.e., modelReferences). Note that the same input may have several annotations indicating the type.
        Parameters:
        operationUri - the URI for which we want to obtain the outputs and their annotated types
        Returns:
        a Multimap with the outputs and their corresponding types.

      • listMandatoryParts

        Set<URI> listMandatoryParts(URI messageContent)
        Obtains the list of mandatory parts for a given Message Content
        Parameters:
        messageContent - the message content URI
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs with the mandatory parts of the message content. If there are no parts the Set should be empty NOT null.

      • listOptionalParts

        Set<URI> listOptionalParts(URI messageContent)
        Obtains the list of optional parts for a given Message Content
        Parameters:
        messageContent - the message content URI
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs with the optional parts of the message content. If there are no parts the Set should be empty NOT null.

      • listModelReferences

        Set<URI> listModelReferences(URI elementUri)
        Obtains the list of model references for a given element.
        Parameters:
        elementUri - the URI of the element for which we want to obtain the model references
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs with the model references of the given element. If there are no model references the Set should be empty NOT null.

      • listElementsAnnotatedWith

        Set<URI> listElementsAnnotatedWith(URI modelReference)
        Given a modelReference, this method finds all the elements that have been annotated with it. This method finds exact annotations. Note that the elements can be services, operations, inputs, etc.
        Parameters:
        modelReference - the actual annotation we are looking for
        Returns:
        a set of URIs for elements that have been annotated with the requested modelReferences.

      • listOperationsWithInputType

        Set<URI> listOperationsWithInputType(URI modelReference)
        Given the URI of a type (i.e., a modelReference), this method figures out all the operations that have this as part of their inputs.
        Parameters:
        modelReference - the type of input sought for
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs of operations that can take this as input type.

      • listOperationsWithOutputType

        Set<URI> listOperationsWithOutputType(URI modelReference)
        Given the URI of a type (i.e., a modelReference), this method figures out all the operations that have this as part of their inputs.
        Parameters:
        modelReference - the type of output sought for
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs of operations that generate this output type.

      • listServicesWithInputType

        Set<URI> listServicesWithInputType(URI modelReference)
        Given the URI of a type (i.e., a modelReference), this method figures out all the services that have this as part of their inputs.
        Parameters:
        modelReference - the type of input sought for
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs of services that can take this as input type.

      • listServicesWithOutputType

        Set<URI> listServicesWithOutputType(URI modelReference)
        Given the URI of a type (i.e., a modelReference), this method figures out all the services that have this as part of their inputs.
        Parameters:
        modelReference - the type of output sought for
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs of services that generate this output type.

      • listDocumentsForService

        Set<URI> listDocumentsForService(URI serviceUri)
                                 throws ServiceException
        Lists all documents related to a given service
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the service URI
        Returns:
        the Set of URIs of all the documents related to the service
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • getMsmType

        Set<URI> getMsmType(URI elementUri)
        Given the URI of an element, this method returns the URI of the elements from the Minimal Service Model it corresponds to. That is, it will say if it is a service, operation, etc. Note that in the case of messages parts, the entities will have two types.
        Parameters:
        elementUri - the URI to get the element type for.
        Returns:
        the URI of the MSM type it corresponds to.

      • deleteService

        boolean deleteService(URI serviceUri)
                      throws ServiceException
        Deletes the given service After successfully deleting a service, implementations of this method should raise a ServiceDeletedEvent
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the URI of the service to delete
        Returns:
        True if it was deleted or false otherwise
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • deleteService

        boolean deleteService(uk.ac.open.kmi.msm4j.Service service)
                      throws ServiceException
        Deletes the given service After successfully deleting a service, implementations of this method should raise a ServiceDeletedEvent
        Parameters:
        service - the service to delete
        Returns:
        True if it was deleted or false otherwise
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • clearServices

        boolean clearServices()
                      throws ServiceException
        Deletes all the services on the registry. This operation cannot be undone. Use with care. After successfully clearing the services, implementations of this method should raise a ServicesClearedEvent
        Returns:
        true if the service registry was cleared.
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • serviceExists

        boolean serviceExists(URI serviceUri)
                      throws ServiceException
        Determines whether a service is known to the registry
        Parameters:
        serviceUri - the URI of the service being looked up
        Returns:
        True if it is registered in the server
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • listServicesWithModelReference

        Set<URI> listServicesWithModelReference(URI modelReference)
        Given the URI of a modelReference, this method figures out all the services that have this as model references.
        Parameters:
        modelReference - the type of output sought for
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs of operations that generate this output type.

      • listOperationsWithModelReference

        Set<URI> listOperationsWithModelReference(URI modelReference)
        Given the URI of a modelReference, this method figures out all the operations of which services have this as model references.
        Parameters:
        modelReference - the type of output sought for
        Returns:
        a Set of URIs of operations that generate this output type.
